original: @49b * // dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @49b * // dpal rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: gzhan gyi rig sngags bshig par 'dod pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rig sngags bshig par 'dod pas /
translated: If one wishes to destroy the mantras of others,

original: dur khrod kyi ras la 'khor lo rtsibs sum cu so gnyis pa bris te rtsibs rnams su h'um log pa bri /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi ras la 'khor lo rtsibs sum cu so gnyis pa bris te rtsibs rnams su h'um log pa bri /
translated: one should draw a wheel with thirty-two spokes on cloth from a charnel ground, and write the syllable hūṃ in reverse on the spokes.

original: mu khyud la a'a li dang k'a lis bskor /
analyzed: mu khyud la a'a li dang k'a lis bskor /
translated: Encircle it with the vowels and consonants.

original: lte bar che ge mo'i rig sngags shig shig ces pa bri ste /
analyzed: lte bar che ge mo'i rig sngags shig shig ces pa bri ste /
translated: In the center, write, “Destroy the mantra of so-and-so.”

original: aom ghurna ghurn'a ghurn'a pa ya ghurn'a pa ya phat ces stong phrag lnga pa zlas la 'khor lo de 'o ma dang sbos chus bkrus nas nim pa'i dud pa la bdugs te /
analyzed: aom ghurna ghurn'a ghurn'a pa ya ghurn'a pa ya phat ces stong phrag lnga pa zlas la 'khor lo de 'o ma dang sbos chus bkrus nas nim pa'i dud pa la bdugs te /
translated: Recite the mantra oṃ ghurṇa ghurṇa ghurṇāpaya ghurṇāpaya phaṭ five thousand times, wash the wheel with milk and water, and fumigate it with nimb incense.
Take it to a charnel ground.

original: shing la brgyangs nas bzhag pas nges par 'grub bo //
analyzed: shing la brgyangs nas bzhag pas nges par 'grub bo //
translated: Hang it on a tree and leave it there. It will definitely be accomplished.

original: gzhan gyi rig sngags bshig pa'i phyir zlog pa zhes bya ba slob dpon ye shes rdo rje mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: gzhan gyi rig sngags bshig pa'i phyir zlog pa zhes bya ba slob dpon ye shes rdo rje mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The Repelling composed by the master Jñānavajra is completed.
